availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry J. "Jack" Baird (Bath County, Kentucky, tailor and farmer.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, tailor and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mariah Baird. Tailor in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Bath County 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Bath County 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 104B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 41.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 75A.
"H.J. Baird (1816-1894)," Find A Grave, Memorial 25960588, accessed July 8, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25960588.
